messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: REPORT #: 85660 DATE: 11/05/23 TIME: 16:10 INCIDENT: Smuggling  INVOLVING DETECTIVES: DETECTIVE D. E. Robinson Sr. DETECTIVE H. I. Jones DETECTIVE J. K. Lambert  SUPERVISORY: Lt. F. G. Stevens - OPERATIONS Captain L. M. Newton ASSISTANT CHIEF DEPUTY R. Simmons  OTHERS INVOLVED: Sgt. N. O. Palmer Sgt. P. Q. Ross Technician Veronica  DETAILS: On the evening of November 5, Det. D. E. Robinson was alerted to a potential smuggling operation at the city port. This information came from two key informants: Mr. Lopez, a dock worker, and Ms. Bennett, a customs officer.  Mr. Lopez reported witnessing suspicious activities related to cargo movements in and around the port area. Ms. Bennett provided insight into irregularities found within shipping manifests that didn't match up with what was expected.  Technician Veronica was tasked with cross-referencing these manifests against the official records, which led to the discovery of inconsistencies in the shipping details.  By 5:30 PM, a collective effort between Detectives Robinson, Jones, Lambert, and under the supervision of Lt. Stevens pinpointed three containers that could potentially hold contraband. With authorization from Captain L. M. Newton, a covert inspection was initiated.  Coordination with port security was managed by Sgt. Palmer and Sgt. Ross. The inspection, completed by 7:45 PM, revealed illegal contraband in two out of the three flagged containers.  EVIDENCE COLLECTED:  Shipping Manifests Witness Statements from Mr. Lopez and Ms. Bennett First Information Report (F.I.R) Photographs of the Containers Port Security Logs [Details redacted for security purposes] INFORMANT INFORMATION: Name: Bennett, Alice Address: 185 Maple Drive, Harbor Town, Delaware Phone: 228-1555 Identification #: 94995  Name: Lopez, Miguel Address: [Redacted for privacy] Phone: 230-4575 Identification #: 90-5950-117  STATUS: Investigation Ongoing. The two containers containing illegal contraband have been secured, and further inspections are scheduled for the remaining containers in the vicinity. A more detailed report will be sent to the detective division for further examination and action.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: DETECTIVE D. E. Robinson Sr. Officer Context: Was alerted to a potential smuggling operation and was involved in the identification and covert inspection of suspicious containers. Officer Role: Detective  Officer Name: DETECTIVE H. I. Jones Officer Context: Collaborated in the effort to identify suspicious containers potentially holding contraband. Officer Role: Detective  Officer Name: DETECTIVE J. K. Lambert Officer Context: Collaborated in the effort to identify suspicious containers potentially holding contraband. Officer Role: Detective  Officer Name: Lt. F. G. Stevens Officer Context: Supervised the detectives in their effort to pinpoint the suspicious containers and was involved in the overall operations. Officer Role: Lieutenant  Officer Name: Captain L. M. Newton Officer Context: Authorized the covert inspection of the containers identified as suspicious. Officer Role: Captain  Officer Name: ASSISTANT CHIEF DEPUTY R. Simmons Officer Context: Mentioned in the supervisory context but specific duties or actions are not detailed in the report. Officer Role: Assistant Chief Deputy  Officer Name: Sgt. N. O. Palmer Officer Context: Coordinated with port security during the inspection of the flagged containers. Officer Role: Sergeant  Officer Name: Sgt. P. Q. Ross Officer Context: Coordinated with port security during the inspection of the flagged containers. Officer Role: Sergeant  Officer Name: Technician Veronica Officer Context: Tasked with cross-referencing shipping manifests against official records leading to the discovery of inconsistencies. Officer Role: Technician
